intro: Mulinum famatinense, commonly known as the Famatinian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture. Mulinum famatinense is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
